definition: with all of one's heart
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to tax one's ingenuity
to experience one's full share of sorrows (idiom)
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through

sentences.english: I hope Your Most Reverend will take the lead and we shall do our best to follow in this work.
sentences.chinese: 希望大主教能带头领导，我们将尽心尽力追随。

sentences.english: With a period of only thee weeks, five prisoners succeeded in escaping from the prison.
sentences.chinese: 那囚犯费尽心机找一个越狱的办法，他终于成功了。

sentences.english: We takeheart as we continue to work and pray.
sentences.chinese: 我们将继续尽心事工和祷告。

sentences.english: He contrived to get himself disliked.
sentences.chinese: 他费尽心思反而于自己惹人讨厌。

sentences.english: He worked to create an environment where she could pursue her writing.
sentences.chinese: 努力经营出版社，好让吴尔芙可以尽心写作。

sentences.english: They entered into a covenant to seek the Lord , the God of their fathers, with all their heart and soul.
sentences.chinese: 他们就立约，要尽心尽性地寻求耶和华他们列祖的神。

sentences.english: You and all your classmates have struggled to get jobs since graduation.
sentences.chinese: 毕业后您和您所有的同学都为求职费尽心机。

sentences.english: We will be dedicated for you to develop new markets, achieve a win-win situation.
sentences.chinese: 我们会尽心竭力为你们开拓市场，实现双赢。

sentences.english: Pray for the Lion of Judah to capture his heart, mind and soul.
sentences.chinese: 愿他为犹大支派的狮子尽心尽意。

sentences.english: Repeatedly, the Bible says to "serve the Lord with all your heart.
sentences.chinese: 圣经上接二连三的要我们“尽心尽意的侍奉主”。

sentences.english: Kinglony 's success depends on talent excellence, dedicated staff.
sentences.chinese: 金隆的成功，有赖才干卓越，尽心尽力的员工。

sentences.english: Others are trying their best to approach teachers in order to find out some examination questions.
sentences.chinese: 有人费尽心机地接近老师，为了套出些考题。

sentences.english: Tabloid gossip derives its entertainment value from subtle suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 八卦小报费尽心思，企图从细枝末节中发现文娱价值。

sentences.english: This is the painting which he worried out.
sentences.chinese: 这就是他费尽心机搞到手的那幅油画。

sentences.english: Every part of our life provides an opportunity to offer God our best, in faith.
sentences.chinese: 我们凭著信，也可以用生活中每一环节来尽心敬拜神。

sentences.english: It may be said that the teacher has done his very best to educate and help him.
sentences.chinese: 老师对他的教育帮助可谓尽心尽力。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
motive/intention/to be diligent or attentive/careful
responsible and diligent (idiom)
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to discharge one's duties/conscientious
heart and soul/wholeheartedly
to attend to personally/in person
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
diligence/diligent/industrious
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
to follow everywhere/to always be there for sb at their beck and call
